Delight your clients by asking for their vision, giving helpful recommendations, and asking for feedback along the way
Don't fright your clients by being overly open about your opinions vs. their opinions, or by not asking for feedback throughout the process
Delight your clients by showing (not telling!) your awards, making it personal to the couple, and being approachable and transparent
@Team_Bolden @JPJeanine Great ideas!
Don't fright your clients by bragging about your successes, seeming too busy to be reached, or being too pushy when asking them to book you

RT @lflugga: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I—
I took the higher one.
And that has made all the difference. 
@WeddingWireEDU
Delight your clients by taking the high road, being respectful of competition & making helpful suggestions for other vendors if they need it
Don't fright your clients by trash talking the competition, asking who else they're considering & being unwilling to work with other vendors
Delight your clients by asking a few key questions to get to know the couple, being open-minded and being interested in their wedding vision
Don't fright your clients by pre-judging couples and their wedding vision or focusing on a personality match before answering questions
Delight your clients by sharing your expertise, being helpful to guide decisions without forcing them and by being excited to work with them
Don't fright your clients by brushing off their ideas, making assumptions about the event before asking, or rushing the appointment
Delight your clients by asking about both partners, getting to know how both are involved, and by not assuming which partner has which role
Don't fright your clients by only focusing on the bride, using non-inclusive language, and completely ignoring their partner
@JPJeanine It was 'Point of View' - understanding where they're coming from!
Delight your clients by using a professional email address, using easy-to-read & helpful emails, and by spell checking all your emails
Don't fright your clients by using hard-to-read fonts like Comic Sans, using amateur email addresses, or using poor spelling and grammar
Delight your clients by providing a price range or starting point, and be direct in your answers to price questions
Don't fright your clients by hiding your pricing information, refusing to share pricing when asked, or scoffing at the client's budget
Delight your clients by responding quickly, asking how they would prefer to communicate, and being responsive throughout the whole process
Don't fright your clients by taking 48+ hours to reply, forcing a communication method or being less responsive after the contract is signed
@JPJeanine No Twitter accounts for Marty or Ashley, sorry!
Delight your clients by being approachable, being upfront about all fees, and asking questions AND listening to their answers!
@encorejoe Thanks so much! Hope you enjoy today's webinar!
